rows.section_1_title: BUILD HABITS to set up safe online habits

section_1_title.eng: BUILD HABITS to set up safe online habits

section_1_text.eng:
âŒğŸ“± Plan phone-free times in your house, like during meals, homework, or in bed.
â­ Only let your child chat online with people they already know. They should never share personal information in a chat room or with strangers.
ğŸ‘€ Check that web addresses begin with https://. Websites that begin with http:// may not be secure.
ğŸ“ For older children, help them create strong passwords for their accounts. They should be long, contain both upper and lower case letters, numbers and symbols, and should not include obvious personal information. 
â— Tell your child not to click on pop-ups that ask them to download or pay for anything.

section_2_text.eng:
ğŸŒ· Together, look at websites, social media, games, and apps your child uses. 
ğŸ‘‚ Ask questions - this helps you learn more about your childâ€™s interests!
ğŸ’™ If you come across anything worrying together, talk about it with your child.
âœ… Tell your child that they should tell an adult if they feel scared, unsafe or upset about something online.
